column4: We were very happy with the hotel, the staff and the food! The beautiful riad is located in the center of the medina but in a quite street. The service and the food were fantastic and we even received a lot of tips for our time in Fès! We definitely recommend:)

I was fortunate enough to stay here for four weeks. Everything about my time was perfect. Firstly the Riad itself is beautiful, traditional, spotlessly clean, quiet, lovely terrace, hugely comfortable bed, a well stocked library and in a great location. The food was of a high standard, lovingly prepared, delicious and extremely generous portions. However it was the staff who made my trip so exceptional and memorable. I was traveling alone but was made to feel part of their family. My daily questions were answered and I gained an incredible insight into the local life and the culture of Fez. I cannot think of any negatives. I feel exceptionally privileged and lucky to have found this amazing place.

We had the fortune to spend 2 beautiful nights in this Riad. The rooms were spacious and clean and the house itself is stunning! Everything was made better by the warm welcome of Soufiane and his team!! I would recommend this place hands down!

column3: Incredible Riad tucked away in an ancient city
column4: Once you enter this wonderful haven you’ll have trouble just not wanting to stay inside its walls. The on-site staff went above and beyond in accommodating my every need. The manager, Safyan, himself met me at my late-arriving taxi from the airport to help guide the way from the R’Cif gate thru the winding streets. Without his assistance my stay would have been impossible. I had the luxury of being the only guest on the weekend of my stay, I was treated to amazing meals provided by Fatima, their cook, whose cooking was the highlight of my Moroccan trip. For Western/European travelers not familiar with medians, particularly those of this age, you should be aware of streets often being small narrow alleys. The Riad is on the house of 7 Turns so expect to be following this path…

column3: Excellent place to stay in Fez!
column4: I spent a couple of nights in this wonderful guest house in Fez. Quiet and very close to all interesting sites in the medina. Rooms are very unique and the food is also very good. Service is also great, in particular Sufyan the manager is very helpful and can speak several languages. A place I will certainly return if I am ever back to Fez.

column3: Incredible Place to Stay in Fes
column4: Staying at Dar7 Louyat was one of the main reasons why our visit to Fes was an incredible experience. The location centrally located. The interior and the design were immaculate. The place is super quiet and peaceful which made it the perfect place to go back to after spending time in the medina. Starting each day with the wonderful breakfast sitting in the middle of the beautiful interior courtyard was wonderful. The service was great and the manager of the hotel Sufyan was super friendly and helpful. I was amazing at how many languages he speaks including Mandarin Chinese. I would recommend this place to all my family and friends. 住這裡真的是很棒. 裡面乾淨又很安靜. 室內 保留了 非常美麗的傳統設計 加上現代的設備. 管理人Sufyan 非常的親切又會講中文. 給我們一個很美好的回憶. 我 一定會建議我家人朋友在這裡住!

The Riad is beautiful, with an amazing terrace and view of the Medina. It is a bit difficult to find but once oriented to the location, manageable to go to and from. It was very quiet and the staff was very nice.

The riad is lovely; a wonderful place to stay in the old part of the Medina. All of the staff were kind, polite and helpful throughout our stay. It has a quiet and friendly atmosphere. Visiting with friends on the terrace we saw a shooting star which made our stay much more magical.

column3: Most immersive guesthouse experience you can have
column4: If harmony and balance live in one place, it is in this riad. From the location, decoration, to the people, to the venue itself and his soul, which cannot be created however, here, you can feel it in every detail. A magical space in the heart of the medina, which connects us with Fez and with ourselves, in a balance that I have rarely felt while travelling. Younes, the manager is friendly, dedicated, and helpful, turning the experience even more local and immersive with his tips and recommendations. It's easy to feel welcomed and hugged and at the same time completely out of our comfort zone, in a place that seems stopped in time. Extra points also for the manager's musical taste that helps to make the stay even more magical and unforgettable. Thanks Younes, Fatima and all…

column3: Lovely riad in Fez - highly recommended
column4: Our stay at Dar 7 Louyat was one of the best we had during our 10 days in Morocco. The rooms and building are stunning, as are the Medina views from the terrace. The location is great to visit the Medina, central but calm. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly, and the food served within the riad was the most delicious we had in Fez. Dinner and/or lunch at the riad are highly recommended.

i spent 3 nights at Dar7Louyat and i felt more than comfortable there (while traveling alone). The Staff was suuuuper highly friendly and the manager Younes was always the kindest person being helpful & available for questions etc. I enjoyed the calm nights and having breakfast & dinner on the roof terasse. I‘ll definitely come back to this beautiful place.

I spent a few wonderful days at Dar 7 Louyat to celebrate a big birthday with a group of friends. The riad was the best possible choice and everyone was delighted with their own beautiful room. We had an amazing birthday meal and there was even a special birthday cake. It was the perfect place to rest after a long walk through the ancient city of Fes, exploring the medina and coming back with all sorts of things that are on offer. Dar Louyat was supremely comfortable and we were told all about its history by Mohammed who was also very helpful showing us some special places to visit. Altogether an unforgettable experience which I hope to repeat one of these days.

The only good thins is that the place looks really nice and the pics are accurate. But honestly, was disappointed by the service. They charged for the tourist map that in every other place I've stayed was free. Every other place in Morocco greeted one with complimentary mint tea at check in. They charged for it. They managed to not have mint tea the rest of our stay. (Don't know how a place in Morocco doesn't have mint tea). Our room wasn't cleaned on the last day of our stay. We had to check and recheck about ordering a taxi to the train station. On the good side, the night manager seemed to be on top of things and helpful. But otherwise, it seemed like there were no adults in charge. I can only speculate that's because the owner lives in France and was not around. …

My dinner here was a highlight of my trip -- wonderful home-cooked food, with a really nice range of little salads, good variety beyond what I'd usually been getting in restaurants. I think I might have been the only guest the night I stayed, which made the place a bit magical feeling! Very comfortable bed, and I loved the lightbox artwork in my room. I personally was glad not to have a/c, because I prefer not to use it--especially in these houses, which are designed to stay cool. (My room had a big floor-stand fan.) But I'm mentioning it because other people might be expecting it, and fault the place for not having it.

We received a very warm welcome from Rida where the taxi had dropped us off. This Riad is stunningly beautiful. Rida even took our extremely large luggage up the stairs to our room and informed us on times for breakfast. The standard room was well STANDARD! The room itself needs a little love and attention and a bit of decorative warmth. Bed is very squeaky. The bed has more squeak than Bubble and Squeak!! Would recommend ear plugs so you can’t hear the squeak every time you turnover. Room seems neglected but nonetheless comfortable and almost soundproof and pitch black. Best night sleep we’ve had since we arrived in Morocco. The bathroom was beautiful. Very quirky. The shower was great. Breakfast was delicious and served on time every morning. The staff are amazingly…

The riad is well within the medina and a good job we were collected form outside the medina as we might have had a problem finding it. The taxi to and from the airport was organised by the riad and all went well. The food in the evening was very good but we were the only ones dining but ok. We went out around Fes for most of the day and relaxed on the roof area in the sun in the late afternoon. The staff were very attentive Eunice and Red ( apologies for the spelling but he did body building ) they were both very good and Red organised some beers and wine for us which were very welcome. The room we had was big and very comfortable no problems at all Lovely place to stay and a true oasis a beautiful riad.

column3: Over rated - scope to improve a lot
column4: One reason for the low mark is to a degree the fault of the high ratings this hotel has received in the past, which boosted our expectations. Firstly let us say the property is beautiful, the cooking is excellent and the welcome was just what you needs all of which deserve five stars. However too many other things that let this hotel down. 1. Comfort - the room we had was small and the beds, especially the spare bed was extremely uncomfortable 2. The design of the Raid means that when other guests wake up you wake up - not ideal when you haven't slept well. Unfortunately this also applies at night and you have to listen to singing of other guests as you try to sleep. 3. People describe the Riad as peaceful and quiet, but we had a lot of street noise and the smell of the…

Our stay in Fez was a delight. Our hotel arranged for a taxi to be waiting for us at the airport. Then there was a cart waiting to bring us to Dar 7 Louyat. Dar 7 Louyat is located in the old Medina. Rich with history. Dar 7 Louyat is in it self an oasis. Stunning to see and a pleasure to rest our bones from the long walks of the day. We were greeted by Soufiane Dayi. A well informed and charming expert at Dar 7 Louyat. He was very friendly and helpful to us. He helped us set up very reasonable excursions during our stay. Arranged dinners at Dar 7 Louyat and even took a request from us for a dinner. The staff at Dar 7 Louyat were most reliable and friendly. There are fruit drink specials that are freshly made and they are delicious. I especially loved the Lemon Mint drink. So…

Cannot write enough about how great of a Riad this was to stay at. Not only was the cooking fantastic, the actual riad beautiful, and the location nestled into old Fes, the staff were fantastic. Soufian is a great guy who helped us every step of the way and coordinated meals, guides, showed us around town, and even jammed on a guitar with us. Really can’t say enough for how lucky we were to become friends with such a great host.

The riad is as nice as in the pictures and it simply takes away your breath as soon as you enter. Instantly you can relax and enjoy Fès and this wonderful riad with it's perfect staff! The view from the roof terrace is unbeatable and the reception and care during the stay by Sufyan couldn't be better! One of the best riads we stayed in and we definitely will be back!

column3: Amazing riad with even better hospitality. Here you really are a family.
column4: I cannot say enough nice things about this place. The riad is absolutely stunning, from the vaulted ceiling’s with amazing carvings to the home cooked meals and lastly the amazing hospitality. I read many reviews about how this place made you feel at home. I can honestly say staying here was the best decision I made in morocco. I particularly have to thank Sufiyan for making my stay so so memorable. From offering me his own personal hand lotion to bring me a guitar from home, I do not have enough nice things to say about him. He really made the place feel like home. Cannot give this place more than five stars unfortunately, otherwise I’d give it 10. Location is amazing and is in such a place that is easy to find.

So many riads and hotels in Fes, it was so hard to chose where to stay! Staying at Dar 7 Louyat was the best choice! This riad is absolutely stunning, the service is great and the food is delicious. Very friendly atmosphere. If we come back in Fes, no doubt that we will be back at Dar 7 Louyat. Thanks Sufyan and all the team! (Lexie says: Hello Sufyan ;) )

Thank Sufyan大禹 so much for guiding us to the hotel! It was really a good surprise that he could even speak Chinese to us! 謝謝大禹讓我們在非斯感到安全，親切。你的工作熱情還有對我們中國人的友好好客令我們覺得非常非常激動開心！很希望下一次如果再來摩洛哥還可以見到你！We really enjoyed our stay here. Thank the hotel and Sufyan大禹 for everything!

We stayed at this Riad for 2 nights. The place itself is well maintained and very nicely decorated. It has a lovely view from the terrace. The host soufiane he is great, very nice lovely person he greeted us at the gates and took us to the Riad. His English is perfect no problems with communication.He treated us like family helping with anything and everything. The Riad was fully booked on the days we stayed but yet he attended to each and every guest with great respect and politeness arranging tours in and out of fez. I highly recommend this place.

Whe stayed at the Riad 5 days and felt so comfortable about this beautiful and relaxing place. It has been the best Riad of our hole Marocco roundtrip and a big thank you to Sufyan who has been the best guide in marocco. He helpt us with really everything and told us a lot about the maroccans and their culture. He always had time for us and made our trip just perfect.

column3: Elegant riad in the heart of the medina
column4: We spent five nights in this oasis of calm in the midst of the bustling medina - a traditional riad elegantly refurbished at the end of a street with "7 turns". The staff were super helpful and kind, really catering to our every request. Delicious homecooked dinners (especially the chicken tajine). The terrace.has places to sit out and enjoy a superb view over the medina. We slept in the rooms next to the patio - everything super clean and well-cared for. This part of the medina is away from the mass-tourism of the Bab Boujdoul (Blue Gate). Recommended.

The Dar is beautiful and the courtyard is traditional with intricate detail giving a nice ambience. We booked a superior room on the 3rd floor - this room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was great with amenities! A tip: The one window in this room was very tiny and the wooden roof was a bit low giving it a very claustrophobic feeling, however, I think other rooms in the Dar are larger and have big windows so I would recommend you book one of those rooms. The location is pretty central and we did not get lost so don't be discouraged about the location. We had somewhat of an average experience with the night staff. We checked-in late and the Dar was very accommodating and we appreciated this immensely. We had a rented car and picked this Dar because of…

column3: You Feel Like You're at Home
column4: I have lived and traveled all over Morocco since 1980 and as I work in the film business, I have stayed in all the big cities and rural regions of the country. To best describe my stay, I can simply say I have rarely been as well looked after anywhere in Morocco as in Dar 7 Louyat. From the first moment following your luggage as it winds through the streets of the medina of Fes to your final good-bye, the staff makes you feel totally at home and taken under their wing. Naima and Rachid attend to every need, and Khadija delights you with traditional Fassi home cooking, known to be the best in Morocco. Besides the wonderful, friendly service, the traditional Moroccan house is a lovely mix of both Moroccan decorative work (carved plaster and wood, traditionally painted doors) and…

I visited fast for the first time and my stay in this we had made the trip feel like I returned home every night. The staff at the Riyadh way really friendly and the food is the best I’ve had in Morocco. The room was really big and had an extra bed. I visited Fes for the first time and my stay in this Riad made the trip feel like I returned home every night. The staff at the Riad way really friendly and the food the best I’ve had in Morocco. The room was really big and had an extra bed. The Riad is really close to all the souks. I would recommend visitors take a taxi from the airport which is organised by the Riad and to be brought to the hotel it is quite hard to find but once you know the way it’s easy to find your way back.

column3: Getting to the hotel, is not its selling point, but you'll love staying there
column4: We arrived in Fez airport at dusk, and we were picked up by our bus and our guide. We were a group of 18 people, both adults and kids aged 10-12yo. We were taken first to a restaurant immediately after arriving and we finally arrived at the entrance of the medina, quite late (for our travelling standards), that is past 11pm. I had checked that the hotel was well inside the medina and no vehicle can get near there. So, upon getting off the bus, our guide helped us hire too "karossas", namely hand-drawn "trolleys" who loaded all our luggage and started walking to the hotel. We walked under the Bab (Gate) R'cif and through the Place R'cif and then the interesting part started. The alleys that take you in the medina become gradually very narrow and, at places, were not very well…

We had a wonderful stay at this beautiful riad. Don't be put off by the fact that there are a few twists and turns down small laneways to the riad. The hospitality you will receive is amazing. My partner wasn't well before we arrived and everyone went out of their way to make him comfortable and look after us.The breakfast and dinners served in the beautiful internal courtyard are incredible, so delicious!

We had the fortune of staying at Dar 7 Louyat after a mishap with our original booking (we had booked a room at Riad Oulyia but due to a mix up, they ended up not having a room for us). Everyone at Dar 7 Louyat was absolutely wonderful from the minute we walked in! The ladies who take care of the place immediately greeted us with the biggest and warmest smiles, and the customary mint tea. The manager (who spoke perfect English) took the time to walk us through just enough of the basics for our first night and because we were exhausted from our trip, left the rest of the details for the following morning. They were kind enough to order food for us so we wouldn't have to go outside and try to find a decent place to eat, and the next day we had one of the best breakfasts of our…

column3: Charming guesthouse but don't expect to find it without help
column4: I foolishly overlooked the instructions sent to me by Bertrand, the French doctor who owns the guesthouse, about arriving at Dar 7 Louyat. Arriving in the medina by taxi, I tried to find a path through the labyrinth of small streets. Almost impossible. The "louyat" in the name means "turnings". There are seven of them, and that's AFTER you find the Place es-Sefarrine, itself no mean feat. There are signs to the guesthouse but these are only really useful as reference once you already know the way. So my advice is, do not follow my example. The manager, Rachid, will be happy to arrange an escort for you. Once you have been shown the way, it will be easier to find it yourself a second time. What can you expect in the guesthouse? Large rooms, tastefully decorated, with many…

Nice rooms and bedding, taseful decor, great breakfast and caring staff. Location is also good and close to the main tannery. I had to go to the train station in the middle of the night and the staff organized a reliable escort to ensure that I was save.

We had the most wonderful time here. The place is absolutely beautiful and the staff made the stay incredible. We will definitely go back to this Riad. Breakfast was really good, room was nice, clean and the Riad is absolutely gorgeous. We travelled with a 2 years old who was very comfortable and loved his time there. The staff even made him French fries when he got hungry. Highly recommend this Riad.

column3: nice hotel, but management has no class
column4: great interior though very very hard to find. Staff was nice but lying to me about taxi price and not apoligizing or even admitting to ripping me off shows very little class. Avoid if you can, there are better riads in fes

This Riad is the best accommodation we have had while in Morocco and probably one of the best of our lives! The hospitality of the people that run this place has made our stay unforgettable, and we will come back for sure!

column3: Great Experience in Heart of Fez
column4: The location was perfect and the entrance to the Riad is truly an experience about life in Fez. They received us with an amazing mint tea while explaining the architecture of the place and how to get through the medina in Fez... and the staff is absolutely amazing, always smiling and willing to help in all of our requests. Cant wait to be back at this riad and amazing town.

We loved our stay at Dar 7 Louyat. With help from the staff it was easy to find the building even though it is tucked away in the medina. The entryway is a wonderful experience -- walking through the small medina alleys until you come upon the riad and it opens up to a huge courtyard with intricate tiles and tall ceilings. The building's restoration has been done very nicely. We were greeted warmly. Our room was very clean and cozy. Nice bed, separate dressing room and very nice bathroom. Our favorite part: The staff! The chef was always smiling and laughing and showed us our most hospitable experience in Morocco yet. Rashid was very helpful and available if we needed anything. We were interested in connecting with local artisans and the managers of the hotel helped us find…

Amazing Riad hidden among winding and extremely narrow alleys of old medina. Extraordinary impression when you go inside to this beautiful interior... Very friendly staff. An unforgettable experience. You miss this place just when you have left it!

Probably 5 points are not enough! The riad is wonderful and clean with everything you need. But for sure what makes the difference is people working there. I just talk by email with the owner for reservation and he has always been kind. In Fes we have met Mounsieur Rachid (the riad manager) and all his staff: everybody has has been helpful, always kind and smiling. He has helped us with everything: suggestions, tour organisation and all the small things. The food is excellent (best dinner we had in the 4 days) and the woman working in the kitchen has conquered our hearts with her smiles. I really hope to come back one day!!!

My friends and I stayed at the hotel for two days. Very well located in the inner medina. Don´t get afraid of the way in through the medina. At first sight can seem imposible to find the way bakc but once you get around is very easy. Extremelly nice and helpfull staff. Nice breakfast included. I specially recommed having lunch or dinner at the place. It was the best foodie experience in all Marocco.

The Riad is in a very convenient location, rooms are clean, nice and well furnished, the roof terrace gives an impressive view on the medina, but the real added value of the Dar 7 Louyat is the staff, as they all are more than kind. The breakfasts have been quite an experience as well as the dinner.

column3: A true gem at the heart of the old Fes
column4: It was like a trip back in time. The house looks and feels very majestic. It's very well kept and maintained. The staff are as helpful as it gets. They go out of their way to offer the best help they could. Would definitely stay there again when I'm back.

My friends and I have a great time in this riad.highly recommend!good breakfast.best service in Fez.please come to this riad. The room is big and very clean.The lunch and dinner is best in morocco. 强力推荐，大家不要错过，老板人很好，吃的一级棒，很符合中国人的口味，房间很大，很干净，强烈推荐在这里吃午餐和中午餐。

column3: Hard to find, but worth the search!
column4: This is so nice, friendly and tranquil - once you're inside. My goodness, it was so difficult to find in the middle of the souk! "Streets" (most of them just about wide enough for two people to pass) all seemed the same to the untrained eye! Our train to Fes ran very late and instead of arriving while it was daylight, came in so late that it was dark and there were very few people around. Eventually a young man realised we were lost (and he would have the chance to make a few dirhams!) so he led us to our destination. We got a great welcome, with mint tea and big smiles. Breakfast was very nice, with a wonderful selection of freshly prepared foods, served by people who really appeared to enjoy their job. We stayed there for 3 nights and it was really only by the last…

Talk about time travel into a beautiful past! Kudos for your restoration of this gorgeous Riad. When we first arrived at the Place de Rcif, we followed Rachid thru the labyrinthian turns in the maze-like medina with great trepidation wondering if we had made a mistake. When we finally stepped into the riad, it was a world apart! Soaring courtyard, with exquisitely restored moldings and doors, it was beyond our expectations. And the reception, Rachid was courtly and courteous and helpful. Naima was pure delight, always cheerful and an excellent cook. We hope to return when you finish your renovations/restorations next door. One suggestion would be that you provide guests with a map indicating location of riad and how to get about, as well as places of interest and restaurants to…

One word, awesome! I had a perfect 4 night stay at Dar 7 Louyat. A beautiful hidden gem. So quiet and peaceful. I'm so in love with this place. The rooftop was amazing! Naima and Rachid was such a sweetheart. Can't wait to be back..

This hotel is a very old traditional and beautiful raid in the medina in Fes , everything is very clean and order , the interior is really amazing and the view on the roof is also very nice . the staff there are also very nice people . only thing not so good is the location , though it is near the main gate however it is too deep in the short lane and the lane is very dark in the night , it will be hard to find the way in the night . Anyway it is a very beautiful and nice raid . it is a good choice for travellers who interested in the traditional raids in morocco . recommend it to everyone who will travel to Fes

The place is amazing, very traditional decor. Not for you if you're looking for a place with all the mod-cons but is great if you're looking for an authentic, traditional Moroccan experience. The people were very helpful. Rachid was great with helping out in terms of what to see and where to go, Naema was a fantastic help and super friendly. When my son fell sick she walked us to the nearest pharmacy. The food that was prepared was delicious! All in all a great stay and would definitely recommend.

We were met by the owner's sister nearby and personally escorted back to the beautiful Riad. The initial experience upon entering the Riad was breathtaking. There were several gas powered heaters running so the atrium was warm and cozy. It was obvious that a lot of attention went into making the guest experience comfortable. The cook and riad attendants were very sweet and took care of all our needs and wishes. The rooms were amazing and roomy. One of the most comfortable beds/room we stayed in during our 3 week tour of Morocco. The meals prepared on sight were done with TLC and with a lot of pride. Great location topped off our experience; easy to get in and easy to get out.

column3: Three days with great experience with great host!
column4: Stayed here for three days, great host and great chef cooking Moroccan dinner - there's no menu, but everyday is different depending on what's in the kitchen:). Breakfast is included and it always feels like a king/queens serving. The host are Raschid, Naima, and Hardijia. Although I don't speak French, they are super friendly and helped me with all the trips arrangement and tour guide. After a couple days in other cities in Morocco, I always had the feeling that everyone is trying to cheat me until I met this lovely people at this Riad. Three days two nights with them, as a solo traveler, they become friends. I am very grateful and I will recommend all my friends to come here as well, whether you are with family, solo traveler or a couple. (At the same time of my stay, there…

column3: Unforgettable stay at Dar 7 Louayat - recommended
column4: We were a party of 4 that spent a few days in the best accommodation we found in Morocco. The Service offered is top notch: Rasheed came to pick us up outside the Medina and helped us with the luggage. The personnel is kind and cheerful. We were offered a warm welcome, with tea and a chat in a sumptuous Palace. The restored Riad is just awesome with splendid middle ages features. Hisham and her mum turned out to be awesome chefs, and we happened to eat in twice in 3 days. The food was fresh, varied, generous in terms of quanties and stylish at the same time. We were totally satisfied with that. The rooms are spacious, tastefully decorated with spectacular Moroccan bathrooms in respect of the traditional features. We really felt at home and totally relaxed, with a good…

I have to admit this is my first review, but this time it is not possible to share with others the amazing experience we had at Dar Louyat 7. Everything was simply perfect, the perfect mix of availability and discretion very difficult to find, and very much appreciated. We arrived late in the evening in Fes when it was already dark, and fortunately Rochdi came and pick us up, it is better to have an experienced guide for the impact with the Medina after the sunset. Entering in the Riad was really an experience, everything is so beautiful, peaceful and clean. We were alone in the Riad and we stayed in big room cosy and colourful. Everything was perfect, and I believe I want to spend some more few words for Nahima and Khdija: they’ve been absolutely amazing, preparing the best…

column3: Amazing historically renovated Riad in old Medina -Fes
column4: The experience was fantastic: Food (the cooking was the best we've experienced in Morocco), attention to guests and riad in itself were all excellent. Staff was very helpful, friendly and honestly concerned about our well being. The riad is located centrally in old Medina. After several trips to Fes, this is the best and more authentic place that i've seen. We would stay here again for sure and we highly recommend this Riad to anyone visiting Fes.!!

Staying at Dar 7 Louyat absolutely made our stay in Fes. Rochdi met us in the square nearby and brought us to the Riad. There is absolutely no way we would have found it in the maze of Fes. It is imperative that you arrange a pick up with the Riad prior to your arrival! Rochdi also arranged a walking tour for us through the maze of Fes which was great. I have a really good sense of direction but still got lost because street names change, Gates are closed at various hours of the day and everyone on the street tries to tell you things are closed or in the other direction. Given the hecticness of the city we were so thankful for being able to return to the Riad to relax and cool down. As it was August and crazy hot, we were the only guests. We were graciously upgraded us to a…

column3: Stunning restored riad with impeccable hospitality
column4: I couldn't recommend this riad more. It's located very conveniently; about 8 minutes walking from Place R'cif where you can easily direct your petit taxi or find a ride to the new city, airport, or train station. The riad is close to the Dar Seffarine, the traditional copper crafting area, as well as University al-Qarawiyyin, the oldest university in the world. Like many in Morocco the medina in Fes is dusy, overcrowded, and especially bustling at night. Unlike in Marrakech, there is no motorized traffic in the medina which makes for a bit less stress when walking about. The real beauty of Morocco lies behind garden doors and this riad takes the cake. When you walk in, you're greeted with an incredibly well and sensitively restored home covered in beautiful tile work and…

column3: Beautiful Riad; gorgeous food, lovely people!
column4: A really beautiful riad in the centre of the old medina; lovely roof terrace; the staff are really helpful & friendly, & the food is some of THE best I've ever tasted in 15 trips to Morocco! The house has been beautifully restored in traditional style & the rooms are all spacious with lovely bathrooms.

column3: Splendiferous Riad in the Heart of Fez
column4: with it's impressive traditional moroccan architecture, carefully restored and supplemented with modern details Dar7Loyuat truly stands out amongst the numerous guesthouses in the medina of Fez, though thremedous beauty and comfort is by far not everything the house has to offer... a lovely and highly professional team attentively takes care of it's guests 24 hours during their stay. Excellent meals cooked by the kitchen staff are available at demand at reasonable prices.

As other reviewers have indicated, the route to the riad is a little disorienting ...BUT once you step foot inside the riad you find yourself in a beautiful palace! We were lucky enough to have the whole riad to ourselves (with friends) and it was a real privilege! The food was sublime and Hisham was a superb host. Super friendly and hospitable. We had young children in the party and the riad was like a fairytale castle to them. Stay here - It is wonderful. (...and order dinner if possible!)

My wife and two children loved this Riad. The service was excellent and the manger Mohammed was accommodating. The local supervisor who Hameed was extremely helpful and nice and was willing to go out of his way to help. The room was cozy and nice and would recommend anyone to stay here. The view from the terrace was great.

Very nice, very charming Moroccan atmosphere, clean, a big roof terrace with a panoramic view all around the Medina. Good breakfast. You are in the middle of Fes Medina. The main point of interest in Fes. Staff came to take us from one of the gate of the Medina to the riad. The Medina maze is disconcerting the first hours, even more at night, then you get used to it and recognize the streets. Streets of the Medina are dusty, perhaps not the best romantic plan but you get something authentic of the Muslim culture.

The Dar is beautifully decorated, the food is delicious and well priced, the management is great. Our room was a double room off of the main quart yard, and was comfortable and warm in January. I would recommend booking Batoul or Rafia suites. They offer more privacy. The roof top terrace is beautiful at night and day. The street leading to the Dar looks a bit sketchy but we found it totally safe day and night. Special thanks to Hisham for making our stay amazing.

column3: The Most Amazing Oasis in Amazing Fez
column4: Dar 7 Louyat is located close the gate of Fez marina, convenient to reach almost everything but more important is it offers a cozy retreat from all the people, color, smell, and sounds of the marina. The architecture itself is amazing, manager Mohammed said they spent about 10 years in refurbishment; the details and the mixture between new and old are impressive. Also love their super fluffy & warm comforter! Manager and other staff are all super friendly, besides useful travel tips of Fez, they also provided a lot of information for traveling around Morocco (since Mr. Mohammed himself is a travel expert too haha). Will definitely visit again and try the home-cooking Moroccan cuisine of the hotel!

column3: Chez moi, chez toi, chez nous...
column4: Fantastic staying in this rihad. Mr Mohammed, was a perfect host and also very respectful of our privacy and intimacy. We were travelling 2 couples, often out the all day for our siteseeing trips, Mohammed arranged twice a very intimate and lovable home-made dinner for us 4. It was amazing to have all the riad for us, as it was our own home down in Fes. The riad is also a piece of art itself, the bathroom in the room is the best part!

column3: Cozy place to stay in Fez
column4: The manager Mohammad is excellent helpful and friendly. Provided us the wonderful home while we would traveling. Especially the service! This is the place you would never regret to spend a day here. The room is big and cozy. The breakfast is nice.

column3: Beautiful base from which to explore Fez
column4: Lovely house. Gorgeous rooms , especially the bathrooms! Abdul took care of us really really well. Feeding us great food. And guiding us how to explore Fez, given we had one and a half days only! So it wasn't just a place to stay but a big part of the whole experience of Fez. Thanks for a memorable stay.

In the heart of the medina. Gorgeous décor, great food, and friendly staff. Abdul the chef/waiter took good care of us from giving tips on walking around the medina to arranging our next day's transportation (he went with us to the bus station late at night!). We stayed for 2 nights and felt very comfortable and secure. Will definitely recommend.

Unfortunately, I planned only one night in Fes. This was my first trip to Morocco and was doing a quick tour of the country before planning my next visit. Simi, Abdu,Myriam, and Naïma are the wonderful staff at this newly owned Riad. The new owner, Bertrand, had just opened it at the beginning of December. You would never know it though. Not a thing was out of place, not a misstep by anyone. Professional, knowledgeable, and friendly. I regret not being able to stay longer. Dinner and breakfast were delicious. Sipping a Moroccan rose was a nice surprise. I chose to travel in December and realize that buildings in Morocco were designed for the 7 months of relentless heat and not for keeping me warm in the cooler months. It is very difficult to find so be sure to contact Simi or…

We stayed at the Dar 7 Louyat for 4 nights over New Year's Eve with our 3 year old daughter. Having visited Marocco a few times over the past 15 years, we have never encountered such magnificent accomodation. The building, its architecture and the loving and respectful restoration and decoration it has undergone make the experience equivalent to staying in one of the city's medersas or palaces. The experience of islamic architecture in all its spendor is unmatchable. The riad is nestled in one of the key áreas in Fes, very close to the Qairayuine Mosque, so you can enjoy all the city's vibration and the extreme peace and quiet of the riad. We used the transfer to and from the airport that was offered through the riad and iot proved useful and hassle-free. Breakfast was served…

column3: Beautiful hotel, just a bit lack of atmosphere
column4: Loved the decoration and wonderfull bathroom. the woman that cooked and cleaned were lovely! Cancelling our room late minute was not a problem. We found that very understanding. Difficult to find though.

column3: A little palace in the Medina
column4: The locaction and interior of the Riad is absolutely beautiful. It is decorated very tastefully and is not over decorated like other Riads. It is a perfect hideaway in the busy Medina of Fez. The food served by Miryam is very good and way better than in any restaurant we have tried during our stay. The medina of Fez beats any medina we have ever seen in other cities. It woud be good if there would always be somebody around who speaks at least some English. WiFi didn't work in our room on the top floor at all.

It is a lovely hotel, located in the Medina, near the Great Mosque Quaraouiyine. It is very beautiful, each detail and decoration are incredible. The rooms are special, comfortable and large. The hotel is like a historical place, whole architecture is fantastic and so beautiful. We were delighted in staying here. We were very well received by staff with a delicious moroccan tea and good talk.

We could not have been more thrilled with our stay at Dar 7 Louyat. The building itself is a testament to the hosts' passion for art history and commitment to traditional crafts, materials and techniques, as well as to their passion for true hospitality. The courtyard is a museum quality restoration and each of the rooms is a unique blend of Moroccan decor, with touches of Mid-Century Modern. We were greeted by the manager, Simohammed, who throughout our stay, was friendly, informative and imminently available when we had questions or needed any guidance regarding the medina. He is a great asset to the Dar 7 Louyat. The shining jewel of Dar 7 Louyat is Myriam, whose traditional cooking was so delicate and expertly prepared that we decided to eat "at home," every night of our…

There are six intimate but large bedrooms spread through the three story atrium overlooking an interior fountain and with an access to a large terrace. The restoration is done with sensitive attention to architectural details and a flare for classical Moroccan interiors. Located near the great Mosque Qaraouiyine, thus easily identifiable to a lost traveler. The welcoming atmosphere could not be the same without the manager Saïda and Miriam that is always available and cooks fabulous meals at a day notice that competes with any Fès restaurant.
